reviews.review_msg: He's many engineering students' introduction to university and for that role, he is not a bad choice. Lectures are clear and easy to follow, and the topics chosen are varied and interesting enough to get students interested for the rest of the degree.

I enjoyed Mike's class a lot, he is an engaging lecturer and has a good sense of humour. The group project will become tedious but it was a good experience nonetheless. The final paper is essential to doing well, so make sure you put in the effort. Quizzes are based on readings AND lectures, he'll give hints in lecture on what will be on the quiz.

Final project can be extremely fun depending on your group members and topic choice. Make sure not to leave everything til the last minute.   Just read the textbook and go to lectures and you should be fine for tests. Lectures are hilarious and interesting.

This was a very interesting and enjoyable class! Although a lot of the topics  talked about are in his book, should go to lectures anyways because they can be entertaining and thought provoking. John Jones is very wise.

This is an engineering history class that covers nearly 1,000,000 years.  Jon Jones presents it in an interesting and passionate way.  No need to take notes in his class, just pay attention during lectures.  The final group project can be a lot of fun if you choose the right topic.

Dr. Jones is a great prof.  He's super enthusiastic about pretty much everything he lectures on.  You can get by in the class without reading the textbook, but on the tests there are quite a few questions on the tests on material not covered in lecture, so you're better off reading the text.
A great proff, great man too. you wont regret taking him, just study ahead for his quizzes and his mock tests, they need some attention.
really nice guy easy B guranteed. Never attended his lectures just went home and studied instead but overall this course brings your gpa up
John Jones is the most interesting man in the world. But, in all seriousness, extremely interesting to listen to, amazing course, and you can tell he loves to talk about it.
Great professor! I took his class my first term at SFU and really helped me start out on a good footing. His lectures are so fun and interesting, they are the only ones I goto!
awesome teacher love his shoes
One of the best professors at SFU. Even if you aren't an ENSC major you should try to take his course. He's awesome.
Excellent prof. the combination of good personality and high knowledge. I love him
extremely helpful, fair  and knowledgeable
Excellent teacher. Very smart guy. Love the accent. His lectures are very interesting. Reading the book helps a lot for the quizes. Overall a very good professor.
the lectures are boring..just read the text book
He is a nice and helpful, while at the same time an interesting professor who makes the course fun.

Teaches with wit, hands, and interesting slides and videos. Supposed to have come for a 10 minute presentation and he grilled us for 25! I think he really liked it and wanted to know more! Very approachable. Liked to 1st class where he broke us up into our tutorial groups for the semester.
It was good in the beginning of the year when it was history, not anymore though...
AWESOME TEACHER, I love his British accent, make it really easy to listen to.

My favourite prof. Very interesting lectures on a myriad of engineering topics. He is a great speaker, witty with a good sense of humour. 3 quizzes instead of a final. Pay attention and study his notes to get a pretty easy A.

I heard this class was easy... but it definitely isn't. 3 quizzes instead of a final, and most of the questions required deep understanding.. I couldn't just attend lecture and read the notes; still did terribly.. otherwise he's an interesting prof

Very clever wit, introduces a ton of new ideas with clarity. Added many guest speakers on many subjects that I didn't know I would be interested in! I'm looking forward to any other classes that I may have with him. He made me think in a new way about everyday things.

very nice prof. as long as you speng a little time you'll get an A. this is the easiest course you could possibly encounter in engineering, if you have difficulty in this course then I recommand you to not continue with engineerin. use this course well to boost up your gpa and good luck.
Nice guy, enjoys teaching, even comes out to student activities (paintballing).  Lectures are kind of a joke, but what do you expect when he is teaching a filler course.
Awesome Prof. Welcomes you whole heartedly as a 1st yr student. Go to the lectures for fun. Read them before the final. U'll get an A
great ever

He is an excellent man and a very helpful instructor. If you want to borrow his trancparencies or video cassettes, he deffinitely gives them to you. The final exam is not easy; try studying the lecture notes during the term. Good Luck!
kick ass prof...best prof u can prbly have.

The best teacher ever...
 John Jones Rocks...
very good
It's alright.
Very good prof and an excellent lecturer
very good prof.!!!
We'll miss you Jonesy
No Comments
No Comments
Most boring class ever! Please, the point of the class was to learn about engineering and society, to think and stuff, not too memorize pointless facts.
good teacher, just super ultra boring material.. By the end of the semester (if u still show up), he'll make u wanna work in da submarine.
Obsessed with his underwater stuff... and extremely boring... and no point of going class cuz he is so easy!
The more spiritual, philosophical and intelligent engineer/prof. Might be boring to the most, but very insightful and interesting to some.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Very intelligent guy. He may not teach well, but he can really help you out if you have any personal problems. Very nice prof.
I didn't learn anything from his lecture in this past semester.. boring..sucks
, anwell, his lecturesd very boring....he should retire by now
not clear... always talk bout underwater stuff
sometimes boring / sometimes funny , very very unpredictable
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
He is absolutely boring.
